posts.description:
After a day of talking about food but not cooking I worked up an appetite for this kind of bowl: spicy Tempeh with whole wheat spelt spaghetti, watermelon and a ginger/soy sauce. I'm dreaming about a holiday to Bali and Indonesia soon so I can enjoy temeph in its birth place, with palm trees and a tropical atmosphere ‚ô° dreaming is always possible right.

When buying tempeh I noticed a huge quality difference between brands. Get your hands on the good stuff from a bio dynamic shop. Also I really enjoy tempeh made of rice. And if you feel insecure about making tempeh you'll find a really good and easy recipe for tempeh steaks in my book (link in profile)

Also a tip for the dutchies. @plantaardigheidjes sell vegan products online and is a personal an passionate store for plantbased food. Check it out üôå

#tempeh #finditliveit #healthyish #hungry #veganfoodshare #vegetarian #friyay #feedfeed #BowlsofGoodnessBook #bowlsofgoodness

My lunch bowl-  Steamed cavolo nero, broccoli and mushrooms with soba noodles, papaya, tofu and and a red curry dip was so delicious and easy so I'm sharing a quick loose recipe right here. 
1. Steam sliced mushroom, chopped leaves of cavolo nero and broccoli florets for 4-5 minutes. Salt to taste. 
2. Press out the excess moist gently from the tofu. Cube it small and fry with a little oil until it's drier and golden. Sprinkle a little salt and a generous amount of nutritional yeast over the tofu and toss to mix, remove from the heat. 
3. Cook the soba noodles for 4 minutes,  rinse in cold water and drain. 
4. Mix 1 teaspoon of thai redcurry paste with 100 ml coconut yoghurt (or cashew crram or creme fraiche if you prefer ). -

5. Assemble the noodles and steamed vegetables in bowls and top with fresh papaya or mango, avocado and hemp hearts ‚ô°‚ô° drizzle a little toasted sesame oil over everything and serve with the coconut and red curry dip sauce. Keep Shoy sauce  on the table.

The only thing I missed doing was naming this bowl properly. It's a form of buddha bowl with thai influnces. Any suggestions? -

Ps. These lovely ceramic bowls are from @junsjoanne

#dinner #buddhabowl #bowlsofgoodness #veganfoodshare #vscogrid #foodandwine #glowfood #naturalkitchen #nourish #eeeeets #thechalkboardeats #foodphotographer #vegetarian #globyfood #lifeandthyme #onmytable #feedfeed @feedfeed #healthyfoodshare #kaleyeah #buzzfeedhealth #glutenfree

Where is Instagram heading? The shadow ban, it sounds like it‚Äôs a spell from the Ministry of Magic and issued by Voldemort himself. After chatting about it with other Igers recently, I checked my own account and found that it indeed had been shadow banned, I wasn‚Äôt visible on the hashtag indexes from the outside anymore. And the numbers of comments and likes had dropped significantly. I never bought likes, used bots or engaged in other actions that get‚Äôs you banned. But apparently shadow banning happens to a majority of big accounts now.

Maybe some people think that we should just get over it and accept that this is part of the business machine, but I just don‚Äôt see how Instagram will manage to keep it‚Äôs users happy by slowly strangling their reach. This affects the creativity and spontaneity of the posts. It‚Äôs a downwards spiral for sure.

I also find it a real shame that the platform has changed it soul. Instagram used to be a platform where people from every background, in any location, could make it based on talent and not necessarily by money and IRL network. 
When the feeds were organic and likes could explode into thousands in the first two minutes it could really mean a new career for young talents. Young creatives used to find a career path by growing their artistic confidence on Instagram and many accounts had life changing opportunities after being discovered here. I‚Äôm a little sad that this isn‚Äôt possible anymore in the same sense for younger people. I had my cosy design career before Instagram but my presence here boosted work and delivered book contracts which I‚Äôm very grateful for. 
It‚Äôs a shame that this will be less possibly for others in the future, Instagram used to prove that audiences prefer real voices and creativity to carefully curated advertising campaigns. And I guess it was an utopia that couldn‚Äôt last since Instagram aims for business and not charity? 
So what to do about it? Get over it or get out of it? What‚Äôs your opinion. Did you experience the Shadow ban too?
#shadowban - - -
#vegetarianfood #foodphotographer #lifeandthyme #buzzfeed #instagram #foodstyling #cookbook #healthyish #fitfam #pasta #foodies #weekend #community

I have'nt had a chance to shoot food here in Sharjah/Dubai yet but I can assure you that food is good here, I'm indulging in the creamiest hummuses for breakfast lunch and dinner and the tabbouleh here is more herbs than grains. Desserts are fantastic. There's no shortage of pistage nuts as expected. Loving it. Have a lovely end of the week peeps ‚ô° this rose and pistage granola is from the #BowlsofGoodnessbook
#BowlsofGoodness
On my way to Sharjah and their annual book fair. So exiting. Will be cooking bowl food on stage.
Another zucchini fritter shot üòâ. If you want to make something like this soon, a hot tip is to check out the recipe for vegan zucchini fritter from lovely @wholygoodness blog ‚ô°

Easter can be celebrated in so many ways. I'm not very traditional but I think the egg symbolism is aligning very well with spring and the birth of new ideas. And here's one of my recent ideas üòâ a zucchini fritter with feta and egg that was also my easter lunch yesterday (and is a part of an ongoing project that I'm having lots of fun with)... and the creamy stuff is my latest sauce crush; roasted cashew sauce with lime and chili pepper ‚ô°.
What's your favourite sauce right now?
Happy Easter Morning. Spicy vegan mexican breakfast bowl from B.O.G

Pink Saurkraut from last week ‚ô° and some book news. For those of you interested in special Bowl Food Pop up Dinners and other Bowls of Goodness events this year, sign up for the newsletter on N/A blog, for updates on where and when's. Soon the dutch, swedish, german and danish edition of Bowls of Goodness are released (and there's a norwegian and spanish edition on the way too). Have a lovely easter holiday peeps ‚ô°

Extra love to the accounts tagged in this picture today üí´, such a buzz seeing your remakes in stories and posts ‚ô°‚ô°
#BowlsofGoodnessbook
